image.altText: an aboriginal man wearing a blue and yellow shirt waits to see a doctor in a clinic

props.synopsis: First Nations people living in the remote Northern Territory are still not expected to reach their 70th birthday. A rare visit inside one of the NT's oldest bush clinics demonstrates why.

title.children: The unlikely killers near Australia's most dangerous river crossing

image.altText: An external shot of a police station.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Aboriginal legal aid service says children as young as 11 are being held overnight at the Palmerston police watch house "with the lights on 24 hours a day", describing the conditions as "breach of human rights".

title.children: 11yo girl held overnight at NT police watch house

image.altText: A man and a woman inside a camper van.

props.synopsis: Twenty-four years ago, the murder of British backpacker Peter Falconio sent shockwaves through Central Australia. The ambush left locals wondering "how something so evil could happen" on their doorstep, and it's a mystery that still haunts the community today.

title.children: How Murdoch's ambush of two backpackers 'changed the psyche' of outback Aussies

image.altText: Young Tigers supporter watches the action from fence during Tiwi Islands grand final day

props.synopsis: Thousands of people flocked to the Tiwi Islands over the weekend to cheer on local teams at the islands' biggest event of the year, the revered annual footy grand final.

title.children: Footy, art and culture draw big crowds to Tiwi Islands on grand final day

image.altText: Three for sale signs on a cul-de-sac in Darwin.

props.synopsis: Interstate investors are targeting homes across the Northern Territory and buying them up hours before they hit the market, as recent data shows Darwin has the tightest rental market in the country.

title.children: Interstate investors swarm NT homes, shutting out locals and raising rents

image.altText: An aerial photograph of Groote Eylandt

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old woman has been flown to hospital in Darwin after being allegedly speared in the head by a man known to her in a remote Northern Territory community.

title.children: Woman speared in head in alleged domestic violence attack

image.altText: A close-up of an Indigenous ranger looking through binoculars.

props.synopsis: Foreign fishers illegally entering Australian waters have been caught in their dozens in the Top End in the past 12 months, marking a concerning spike for rangers.

title.children: In Australia's north, rangers are battling a 'matter of national security'

image.altText: Woman with brown hair in a burgundy top leaning against a wooden pole.

props.synopsis: As new Labor MP Ali France enters parliament, the surgeon who saved her life by taking her leg in 2011 is telling his story for the first time.

title.children: 'Life before limb': As Ali France enters parliament the surgeon who saved her speaks out

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff speaks while standing behind a lectern

props.synopsis: As Jeremy Rockliff continues his pursuit of engineering a minority Liberal government after the weekend's Tasmanian election, the ABC calls a 10th seat for Labor.

title.children: 'Stability' offered to independents, as Labor picks up another seat

image.altText: A crowd of workmen in yellow hardhats and orange high-vis vests swing hammers at a beachside bar.

props.synopsis: Officials have begun destroying beachside villas and restaurants in a tourist haven in southern Bali after 48 businesses were assessed to be "illegally built".

title.children: 'None of them have permits': Popular Bali tourist spots destroyed with hammers

image.altText: Hunter Biden seated outside by a tree in a garden, wearing a button-down shirt and wrist watch, speaking to interviewer.

props.synopsis: Hunter Biden spoke candidly about his previous addictions to crack cocaine and alcohol and criticised Democrats who turned against his father, former US president Joe Biden.

title.children: Hunter Biden takes aim at George Clooney for undermining his dad

image.altText: An aerial view of a group of islands covered in trees and surrounded by reefs and turquoise and dark blue water.

props.synopsis: The United States would send "third country nationals" to the tiny Pacific Island nation of Palau, under a new proposed deal with the Trump administration.

title.children: US looks to send 'third country nationals' to Australia's Pacific neighbour

image.altText: A group of people in front of a brick building holding protest signs. One reads protect academic freedom.

props.synopsis: Harvard University's fight to keep billions of dollars in US government funding has made its way to court. Here is what you need to know.

title.children: Harvard has taken Trump's admin to court over a funding freeze. Here's why

image.altText: Michele Bullock stands behind podium with microphones, with RBA logos behind her

props.synopsis: The majority of the Reserve Bank board are taking a "cautious" approach to cutting interest rates, but hindsight suggests the minority view has been vindicated as the jobs market weakens.

title.children: Reserve Bank meeting minutes shed light on shock 'on hold' decision

image.altText: woman cries into tissue sitting next to others

props.synopsis: An investigation into a South Korean plane crash that killed 179 people has found "clear evidence" that the pilots shut off the engine, but families of the victims say they don't trust the report.

title.children: Families upset with findings of report into South Korean plane crash

image.altText: Emily smiles while wearing a colourful jumper and holding her sleeping baby

props.synopsis: For the first time ever, health professionals will be able to accurately monitor oxygen levels in babies during childbirth to prevent major health issues and unnecessary emergency procedures.

title.children: 'Breakthrough' technology hailed biggest development in fetal monitoring in 50 years

image.altText: Ed Sheeran sits on a pink plastic chair in a pink jumper.

props.synopsis: Ed Sheeran will bring his Loop tour to Australia and New Zealand in 2026.

title.children: Ed Sheeran announces return to Australia following record-breaking tour

image.altText: man and woman stand in kitchen looking uphappy

props.synopsis: There are many reasons someone can be moody, bad-tempered, or sullen, but regardless of why, experts say regular occurrences can lead to disconnect and resentment in relationships.

title.children: The toll of living with someone who is frequently moody

image.altText: An illustration of a large stadium in a green park near the CBD.

props.synopsis: The analysis from Deloitte found south-east Queensland could see growth of almost $40 billion, with a further $31 billion in regional Queensland and Australia.

title.children: Report finds 2032 Games could generate $70 billion in economic opportunities

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court hears it was not a "legitimate expectation" of witnesses at the inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution that material they provided wouldn't be disclosed to media.

title.children: Sofronoff could conduct Lehrmann inquiry 'as he sees fit', lawyers argue

image.altText: Passengers get off a small Qantas plane on the tarmac at a small airport.

props.synopsis: Pilots identified a problem with the Melbourne-bound plane shortly after take-off and returned safely to Mildura.

title.children: Qantas flight forced to make priority landing after 'technical issue'

image.altText: An aerial shot of a two-truck collision on a major highway. Numerous emergency vehicles are nearby.

props.synopsis: Police say the man died before emergency services arrived at the scene south of Newcastle.

title.children: Truck driver dies in crash on major NSW motorway

image.altText: Prabha Kumar, smiling at the camera in a bright pink and gold traditional outfit.

props.synopsis: Indian national Prabha Arun Kumar was stabbed in the neck multiple times by a person dressed in black while walking home alone through Parramatta.

title.children: Sydney mother's stabbing death was homicide, coroner finds

image.altText: AFL player Ryan Crowley pictured looking serious during a game.

props.synopsis: Former Fremantle Dockers player Ryan Crowley appears in a Perth court facing historical charges of assault, threatening to kill, and deprivation of liberty.

title.children: Former Docker Ryan Crowley charged with more violent offences against woman

image.altText: A white rocket comes out of a parked rocket launcher with smoke and fire below.

props.synopsis: Japanese forces fire their most advanced anti-ship missiles off the coast of New South Wales for a second time as part of a military training exercise involving a record 19 countries.

title.children: Japanese rocket launch off Jervis Bay shows off military might

image.altText: A view over Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia.

props.synopsis: A tiny country neighbouring Russia has become a laboratory for a different approach to seizing power.

title.children: As the world watches Ukraine, Russia could be making another power grab

image.altText: A line graph showing electricity demand from 200 to 2024 in front of city skyline with a prominent data centre.

props.synopsis: Australian power demand rose relentlessly until 2008, when it stopped growing. That record has finally been eclipsed, and experts say it is a sign of things to come.

title.children: A power-hungry beast could smash forecasts of Australia's rising power demand

image.altText: A man in glasses raises his hand as he speaks at a lectern.

props.synopsis: The spending on alumni events in May comes as the university says it needs to sack 400 staff to save $100 million.

title.children: University executives rack up $140,000 bill on US trip as 400 staff face sack

image.altText: a man smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The search for missing fisherman Geoff Buchanan off the New South Wales coast is suspended after his empty boat is recovered by authorities.

title.children: Missing fisherman's empty boat found off NSW coast

image.altText: Night scene of a burnt out car in bush, two men bent over, a bright light illuminating the area.

props.synopsis: Three men are counting the cost of an unexplained fire that destroyed their four-wheel-drive vehicles and thousands of dollars in camping gear.

title.children: Three best mates were on a camping trip when everything went up in flames

image.altText: Police tape cordons off a smashed-in shopfront.

props.synopsis: A car has been driven into a charity store in Gippsland, destroying Christmas gifts meant for foster kids.

title.children: Christmas gifts for foster kids ruined in charity store ram-raid

image.altText: The wreckage of a light plane that has crashed in a field.

props.synopsis: The aviation community is mourning the deaths of two experienced pilots as authorities work to uncover what led to the crash that cost them their lives in Queensland on the weekend.

title.children: Pilots identified as investigation into 'terrible tragedy' continues

image.altText: Police officer leaning on car, man blurred with arms crossed in blue shirt, rural background

props.synopsis: A Central Queensland man has been charged with deprivation of liberty and weapons offences for allegedly duct-taping two children and pointing a gun at them.

title.children: Man charged over alleged image of gun pointed at duct-taped kids

image.altText: a couple with their back to the camera

props.synopsis: A couple visiting Tasmania for the first time has told of being pulled to the ground and punched by teens while walking home from dinner in Hobart.

title.children: Teenager charged after assault on tourists in Hobart CBD

image.altText: A generic image of a phone with a lock image and password on the screen

props.synopsis: We asked some experts how password managers work and how they can increase security for those wanting to keep their data secure.

title.children: What is a password manager and are they safe?
